curam.util.rules

Class FixedNumericFormatConversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • curam.util.rules.FixedNumericFormatConversion

  • public final class FixedNumericFormatConversion
extends java.lang.Object
    This utility class is used for converting strings to Money, double and float values.

    • Method Summary

      Returns the money value from the string based on the default locale.
      static Money convertEnglishFormatToMoney(java.lang.String moneyVal, java.util.Locale outputValuelocale)
      Returns the money value from the given string based on the specified output locale.

      Converts a string to a double in English locale.

    • Method Detail

      • convertEnglishFormatToDouble

        public static double convertEnglishFormatToDouble(java.lang.String strValue)
                                           throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts a string to a double in English locale.
        Parameters:
        strValue - The string to be converted. This should be in English locale.
        Returns:
        The double value constructed from the string. An empty string is converted to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - The string is not a valid number.

      • convertToDouble

        public static double convertToDouble(java.lang.String strValue,
                                     java.util.Locale inputValueLocale)
                              throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts a string to a double in English locale.
        Parameters:
        strValue - The string to be converted.
        inputValueLocale - Locale of the input string.
        Returns:
        The double value constructed from the string. An empty string is converted to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - The string is not a valid number.

      • convertEnglishFormatToFloat

        public static float convertEnglishFormatToFloat(java.lang.String strValue)
                                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts a string to a float in English locale.
        Parameters:
        strValue - The string to be converted. This should be in English locale
        Returns:
        The float value constructed from the string. An empty string is converted to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - The string is not a valid number.

      • convertToFloat

        public static float convertToFloat(java.lang.String strValue,
                                   java.util.Locale inputValueLocale)
                            throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Converts a string to a float in English locale.
        Parameters:
        strValue - The string to be converted.
        inputValueLocale - Locale of the input string.
        Returns:
        The float value constructed from the string. An empty string is converted to zero.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - The string is not a valid number.

      • convertEnglishFormatToMoney

        public static Money convertEnglishFormatToMoney(java.lang.String moneyVal)
                                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Returns the money value from the string based on the default locale.
        Parameters:
        moneyVal - Money values as string. This should be in English locale.
        Returns:
        Money objects with the value in default locale
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - The string is not a valid number.

      • convertEnglishFormatToMoney

        public static Money convertEnglishFormatToMoney(java.lang.String moneyVal,
                                                java.util.Locale outputValuelocale)
                                         throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Returns the money value from the given string based on the specified output locale.
        Parameters:
        moneyVal - Money values as string. This should be in English locale.
        outputValuelocale - locale of the Money object that will be returned.
        Returns:
        Money objects with the value in default locale
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - The string is not a valid number or the input string doesn't match with the given input locale.
